186015250.review:
There are two faces to this game.

One is a great omage to The Little Prince and I think it tell a genuinely compelling story (albeit too many times through boring or repetitive missions).

The other face is just a really fun and good sandbox game. I easily got 100 hours of fun out of this game by the time I got bored. I know that reception of the new DLC is a bit ambivalent in the community, but I think the devs deserve every support they can get for sticking with this game through the years.

185971845.review:
Astroneer — игра, которая увлекает своей простотой и глубиной одновременно. Это космический песочник, где ты становишься исследователем далёких планет, строителем, изобретателем и, конечно, авантюристом. Но не думай, что это просто ещё один симулятор выживания — здесь есть своя магия, которая затягивает на долгие часы.

Что такое Astroneer?
Представь: ты один (или с друзьями) оказываешься на неизведанной планете с минимумом ресурсов и задачей — выжить, исследовать и покорить космос. Но в отличие от многих других игр, здесь нет врагов, которые хотят тебя убить, или строгого сюжета, который диктует, что делать. Ты сам решаешь, как провести своё время: копать глубже, строить базы, летать на другие планеты или просто создавать невероятные конструкции из ресурсов.

Почему это интересно?
Исследование и открытия
Каждая планета в Astroneer — это уникальный мир с разными биомами, ресурсами и атмосферой. Ты можешь отправиться в пустыню, где песок переливается под лучами солнца, или на ледяной спутник, где каждый шаг — это борьба с холодом. А ещё есть пещеры, которые уходят глубоко под поверхность, скрывая редкие ресурсы и тайны. Каждый новый объект, который ты находишь, — это маленькое открытие, и это чувство никогда не надоедает.

Создание и автоматизация
Игра предлагает огромный простор для творчества. Ты можешь строить базы, соединять их с помощью трубопроводов, создавать сложные системы для добычи ресурсов и даже автоматизировать процессы. Например, можно настроить завод, который будет перерабатывать руду в полезные материалы, пока ты исследуешь окрестности. Это как LEGO в космосе, только с элементами инженерии.

Космические путешествия
Когда ты освоишь одну планету, можно построить ракету и отправиться на другую. Каждая планета имеет свои особенности: где-то гравитация слабее, где-то сильнее, а на некоторых даже можно найти древние артефакты, которые помогут раскрыть тайны вселенной Astroneer. Это чувство прогресса, когда ты переходишь от простого к сложному, невероятно мотивирует.

Мультиплеер
Играть в Astroneer с друзьями — это отдельное удовольствие. Вы можете вместе строить базы, исследовать пещеры или просто дурачиться, катаясь на космических вездеходах. Кооператив добавляет игре новый уровень веселья и возможностей.

Атмосфера
Графика в Astroneer — это что-то среднее между мультяшной и реалистичной. Планеты выглядят ярко и стильно, а музыка и звуки создают уютную, почти медитативную атмосферу. Это одна из тех игр, где можно просто расслабиться и наслаждаться процессом.

Что может не понравиться?
Конечно, игра не идеальна. Некоторые игроки могут найти её слишком медленной или недостаточно сложной, особенно если они привыкли к более динамичным или напряжённым играм. Также в начале может быть немного непонятно, что делать, но это часть процесса обучения — ты учишься на своих ошибках и открытиях.

Astroneer — это игра для тех, кто любит исследовать, строить и творить. Она не пытается быть сложной или напряжённой, вместо этого предлагая уютный и захватывающий опыт. Если ты мечтал стать космическим исследователем, но не хотел бороться с полчищами врагов, то это твой шанс. Astroneer — это как путешествие в детство, где ты можешь быть кем угодно и делать что угодно, ограниченный только своей фантазией.

Так что надевай скафандр, бери в руки инструменты и отправляйся покорять галактику! 🌌🚀

185954111.review: Astroneer is a charming, well-thought-out open world space survival game. My initial assumption was that this was a low-poly No Man's Sky clone, however, after playing my first couple hours, I realized it was much much more. The game leans towards resource management, and more importantly, inventory management. Never before had I played a survival game and felt satisfied with how I structured my "chest". The crafting mechanics are snappy and progress is steady and very satisfying. The devs also put a great amount of time and care into details. Do NOT place hydrazine in a portable smelter because you ran out of inventory space... you've been warned.

[b]Astroneer - довольно хорошая космическая выживалка со случайной генерацией миров. [/b]

Не очень трудная (например как Stationeers), но и не слишком легкая (подумать тоже надо). 

Игровой движок Unreal Engine позволяет обеспечить красивую графику, да графика в игре угловатая, но она красивая. Звуковое сопровождение тоже хорошее. Музыка в игре успокаивающая. Мир для исследования большой - это множество планет и их спутником и каждая со своими атмосферой, ресурсами и опасностями. Из минусов это не очень удобное управление и физика в игре плохая (как транспорта, так и самого персонажа)

Este es uno de esos juegos que no puedo entender de donde saca esas críticas tan positivas (y ojo no lo digo como un comentario peyorativo hacia los que lo puntúan bien, estoy seguro de que tiene algo este juego que yo no he sido capaz de ver o de apreciar) y es que apenas hace nada bien. El único elemento que veo como algo positivo es que es un juego ligeramente mono.

Como he dicho seguro que hay elementos que a mi se me escapan o que no aprecio pero la verdad es que ni intentándolo puedo ver que tiene este juego.

185822517.review:
Upon first glance I didn't think much about this game and looked like a quick port from mobile to PC. Upon purchasing the game, playing with friends, and making an effort to understand the [b]user interface[/b] better turns out this is a pretty decent game. Astroneer will either appeal to you or won't. It's not as dangerous or hard as other survive / craft builders, but leans a little more towards casual play. Nothing will kill ya except for heights and certain plants.

Astroneer's [b]gameplay[/b] is actually quite rock solid for what it is. The reason (for me) is that the [b]user interface[/b] was done extremely well. Rather than encumbering the player with a loaded inventory, everything is readily available upon a click or a drag. I found this part of the game absolutely unique and an integral part in the [b]gameplay[/b] mechanics. Items feels quick to grab and it all feels natural. That being said, the rest of the game follows any other crafter or builder. The difference here is the player is only able to make complete components rather than sections. The player is able to place where these components go, connect them to power, and rotate them in any way the player would like. Research needs to be done by the player (or by a machine) in order to gain research points. Once enough research points are earned the player can use that to unlock further structures that can refine materials, unlock new carriable or craft able items, and new vehicle unlocks like a floating surfboard or VTOL.

Exploring is interesting. At first the world is a little much to take in as its completely open and not many markers appear. Like I said prior there isn't any heads-up or much to look for or indicate as the player plays. There is a useful index that the player can pull out (and use to unlock other components) in addition to the player being able to access the mission logs through the landing pad. This sort of gives the player a little direction in what to do or where to go. There are different biomes, planets, and moons. Of course, common materials are on every planet (amounts vary), but more specific rare refining materials will vary planet to planet. Although the planets themselves are randomly seeded, there is a consistency in the solar system with the amount of planets and moons. The player is allowed to travel between the planets, but travel wasn't as exciting as I thought it would be. The player casually points to a planet they want to land on (hopefully ensuring they have enough materials packaged before they leave their current planet). There is no free flying of the sort, only vehicles on the planet.

The [b]visuals and graphics[/b] are suitable to the games atmosphere. There is absolutely no [b]user interface[/b] either than the UI directly used in [b]gameplay[/b]. Sort of like Hydroneer, the player has to plan their moves with their limited inventory spots. Instead of pulling up a menu to store items, items are stored right from playing. For example, if there is an item on the ground the player wants to store, they can do that either by picking it up and placing it in their backpack or simply pressing another button (in addition to grab) to quickly store it. Energy and oxygen are both displayed on the back of the backpack. The worlds don't feel too barren, but there aren't any insane views that can be found in the game. The [b]sounds and music[/b] were also well done. Players can pick up on their surroundings by listening to the different noises that the game makes. The [b]music[/b] was soothing and pleasant to listen to. Didn't notice too much repetitive sounds, noises, or music that some games like to do. This domain overall was done well.

Overall, I would recommend this game on sale, but I would really do my homework on it to see if this is the type of game you'd want to play. The bit of automation that is available is pretty cool, the interplanetary travel is cool, but it is all surface level and limited. I was a little disappointed in how much the player was required to jump planet to planet to get one or two bars of something to craft/create. Mind you - it is nice that not a 1000 pieces of something is required to craft. It is more towards the casual side of crafting/building/colony types, but it still offers enough challenge especially as the planets become increasingly difficult. There are objects in the world that can hurt the player, but there is no creature or storm that will pose an immediate threat to the player. The worlds could've used some sort of creatures (in my opinion) just to fill in the space, or perhaps add another layer of [b]gameplay[/b] to the game. It's a good game, just makes me feeling like there is something or a few things missing to take it to the next level. Really sucks the surfboard is unlocked later in the game along with the VTOL. Pretty much beat the game before I unlocked these two. Fun with friends, but some friends felt the game got too repetitive or boring too fast. It was around the 30 hour mark I was like, "OK, may go back to playing something else. I've figured out the formula". 


[h1]RATING: 8.0/10[/h1]

185750575.review:
Generalnie, udało mi się skończyć całego Astroneera, więc mogę powiedzieć, że gra jest generalnie fajna z małymi minusami, ale od początku.

Sama grafika jest bardzo ciekawa i przyjemna dla oka. Planety wyglądają ciekawie i przyjemnie. Oddają klimat swoich założeń. Muzyka również fajnie wpada w ucho i pasuje do całości rozgrywki.

Jeśli chodzi o rozgrywkę. Gra potrafi wciągnąć na długo, jest co robić, zadania rozbudowane, czasami trochę przeciągnięte, lecz potrafią wciągnąć. Gra prosta, bez przemocy więc dobry tytuł dla młodszych użytkowników, które już potrafią trochę pogłówkować. Jest dużo tworzenia przedmiotów i złożonego wydobycia surowców. 

Główna fabuła bardzo fajna, historia opowiedziana również. Warto skończyć, mimo konieczności włożenia trochę czasu w przejście. 

Jeśli chodzi o minusy. Potrafi się zrobić monotonna, ze względu na dużo powtarzalnych rzeczy.
W niektórych momentach zadania przeciągnięte nad wyraz.
Dodatek który jest do osobnego kupienia, niestety patrząc na cenę bez obniżki a zawartość, wypada dość blado. Tam się dopiero wszystko ciągnie. Niby opisują twórcy, że jest bardziej wymagający, a po prostu jest bardziej monotonny. Dodaje tylko jedną osobną planetę. Która i tak nie łączy się z główną rozgrywką (więc zaczynamy od początku grę).

Dla samego Astroneera jako podstawki daję mocne 8,5/10.
Samo DLC 5/10 i najlepiej pokusić się na nie jak ktoś już musi w jakiejś dobrej promocji ale nie za pełną cenę.

Generalnie, prócz tego małego orzeszka w postaci DLC które trochę było męczące, produkt bardzo równy i godny polecenia. Bardzo miło spędzało się w nim czas.

185745362.review:
Its a beautiful game - the graphic design is mesmerising... so much to do, any way you want to do it.
But the small bad - is bad.
The camera/mouse picking issue is still gawd awful, as is vehicles left unattended falling through the ground.
Imagine you've spent weeks building up a base and in a momentary lapse of memory forget to park your rover on unmanipulated ground (as former experience taught you) only to return to your base to be greeted with a scene out of the Philadelphia Experiment - if your lucky. If your unlucky it will have completely vanished to gawd knows where and you'll have to initiate a SAR operation underground and if your lucky enough to find it - you'll have to dig it out and then navigate your way through unfamiliar terrain back up to the surface carving up the place in the process.
The horrendous camera-drift/mouse-picking issue will see your language descend into the sewer fast. The Hold to Rotate doesn't fix this because it is a different problem - its the miniscule final camera drift just as you aim to select an item your trying to move and voila! completely fumble it. It seems to be a simple camera auto drift timing issue that some new setting could address. It is infuriating. Surely - even after 5+ years there is a simple way to fix this.

But I'd still say buy it. It is a superb game. Just so disappointing that these serious issues haven't been addressed in years inspite of the reems of feedback.

2nd thoughts -
Infact after posting this initial review I had a tractor disappear on me and had to go on an hour long SAR under ground in some treacherous terrain - fell thru a few holes - had to go back up to the surface to get packagers - but it was kinda fun.
I would have just left it there and printed off a new one - but you can hear it rattling around down there and its kinda annoying being reminded of it weeks later when your running around your base doing something else - so I had to go and get it - LoL!
I'm on a new playthru - this time keeping my bases to minimum ground manipulation in the hope to avoid disappearing rovers.
It doesn't happen that often though..
I hope some solution can be found to the minuscule auto-refocus issue when selecting/picking-up items, but it isn't a deal breaker imho.
Something like "Turn Off Autofocus Smoothing" option or something...
Also - the new garages/parking bays seem to be hard-locked like the teleport gates.
I would usually build a base around a Teleport gate and park my stuff on that which keeps them safe. I haven't tried this with the new mission Parking bays but I expect they are hard locked to the world like the gates. Or another fix might be - being able to Lock/Unlock vehicles like the way you do with machine platforms which keeps them stable to the ground.
All in all its a superb game, highly re-playable and I highly recommend it.

自动化建造和大地图探索内容都只能说喜忧参半，游戏引导更是抽象且简陋。
在自动化方面，由于并不存在可以持续挖掘的矿点，即使使用了自动精炼机也需要手动搬运原料，这导致材料素材不存在堆量，也不存在戴森球或者幸福工厂那样复杂的制造流程或者蓝图系统。恐怕这种游戏流程只适合喜欢满世界跑和反复收集原料的人。
在大地图探索方面，各种交通工具平衡系统奇差，经常开过一块石头就侧翻或者滚进地下洞穴里，要从洞穴里出来又往往需要漫长的土地平整时间，在自动造氧机出来之前的大地图探索简直是折磨至极。另外这个游戏没有血条，且极其容易摔死，解锁悬浮滑板之后经常滑着滑着就摔死了。
至于游戏引导，这款游戏甚至没有一个能快速打开引导的快捷键，需要你esc再QE切换到引导页面，需要查询高级产物的配方时极其繁琐。

185614363.review:
ASTRONEER was an impeccable use of my time. Never before had I been so curious, so dumbfounded, and so connected to a fantasy world. From explosive plants to singing snails; I love it all.
My friend Cody and I slowly started our journey on Sylva. That journey slowly expanded to moons, planets, and the center of each of those. A solid 10/10 for exploration. Another 10/10 goes to the base building. Building your personalized bases throughout the solar system to survive is possible anywhere. Even Atrox.
In the downtime between the exploring and base building, we created race tracks that stretched near the middle of the world, soccer caves with tractors, and our very own train station. With the Terrain Tool and your imagination, there will be no end to your game play. The only reason I ever stopped was because I beat the game. I recommend saving that for last.
If I ask one thing of anyone who plays this game, you don't have to stick to the linear path. Take this game as you would Minecraft; do as you please, when you please. Bring friends too, always helps.

185607207.review:
Если бы я мог вернуть время назад и снова пережить те бесконечные зимние каникулы с друзьями, когда мы проводили ночь за ночью, смеясь, пытаясь выжить в каких-то абсурдных ситуациях, играя в кооперативные игры, то "Astrooner" — это именно тот тип игры, который мог бы стать неотъемлемой частью этих воспоминаний.

Вот серьёзно, когда я в первый раз зашёл в эту игру, мне сразу пришло в голову: "Так, вот это оно!" — ностальгия по тем дням, когда ты и твои друзья слаженно, но не всегда успешно, пытаетесь выполнить задачу, всё катится в тартарары, и в конце концов один из вас случайно взрывает всю команду, и все начинают смеяться до слёз. "Astrooner" — это про то, чтобы делать это снова и снова, только теперь на космической станции, с видами на планеты и звезды вокруг. Всё так же весело, только теперь мы летаем среди астероидов!

Само по себе, это не просто ещё одна кооперативная игра, а целая система с кучей интересных механик, где вам предстоит работать в команде, чтобы выполнять различные задания на чуждой планете или космическом корабле. У каждого есть своя роль — кто-то чинит оборудование, кто-то добывает ресурсы, а кто-то с удовольствием откроет шлюз и отправит всех в невесомость. Конечно, в процессе появляются всякие курьезы: то кто-то забудет заправить корабль, то случайно откроет врата в самое неудачное время. Но именно это и делает игру такой веселой и захватывающей.

Самое крутое, что игра позволяет почувствовать атмосферу старых добрых кооперативных игр, где главная цель — не просто выполнить задачу, но и просто весело провести время с друзьями. Если вы любите смеяться от души, делая глупости (как я), то тут будет полная свобода для всего этого. Каждый матч — это не просто работа, а целый ряд веселых моментов, которые заставляют забыть о реальности.

Графика игры, хотя и не шедевр, но создаёт правильную атмосферу — космос выглядит как-то уютно, а не пугающе, и всё это с лёгким налётом ретро-футуризма, который идеально подходит для игры, где вам предстоит выполнять задачи в командной динамике. Мелкие детали вроде забавных анимаций, смешных костюмов и всевозможных забавных ситуаций только добавляют игре очков.

"Astrooner" — это игра, в которую хочется возвращаться снова и снова, особенно если у вас есть компания друзей, готовых разделить этот момент. Это не просто игра, а способ вернуться в те тёплые зимние каникулы, когда нет забот, когда ты просто смеёшься с друзьями, решая странные задачи в атмосфере космоса. Здесь не нужно быть суперумным стратегом, главное — получать удовольствие от совместной игры. Поэтому если вы хотите почувствовать настоящую кооперативную магию, "Astrooner" будет отличным выбором.

В общем, играйте с друзьями, запускайте миссии, ржите от смеха, даже если всё пошло не по плану. В этой игре главное — не победа, а весёлое времяпрепровождение. И поверьте, оно того стоит!

185568040.review:
[h1] Astroneer: Kosmiczna odyseja, która nigdy się nie nudzi[/h1] 
Astroneer to gra, która od momentu premiery wciągnęła mnie w swój kolorowy, kosmiczny świat pełen nieograniczonych możliwości. Jako entuzjasta eksploracji i budowy, spędziłem niezliczone godziny, przemierzając proceduralnie generowane planety, zbierając surowce i konstruując bazy. Co jednak najbardziej wyróżnia tę grę, to nie tylko kreatywność, jaką oferuje, ale również możliwość dzielenia tej przygody z przyjaciółmi dzięki trybowi multiplayer. A teraz, z premierą nowego dodatku Glitchwalkers, gra zyskała jeszcze więcej głębi i świeżości.
[h3] Kosmiczna eksploracja na najwyższym poziomie[/h3]
Astroneer w swojej podstawowej wersji daje graczowi niezwykłą swobodę działania. Gra pozwala eksplorować różnorodne planety o unikalnych biomach, terraformować teren, budować bazy i zarządzać surowcami. Mechanika terraformowania za pomocą specjalnego narzędzia to prawdziwy majstersztyk – pozwala tworzyć tunele, mosty czy płaskie powierzchnie idealne pod konstrukcje. Ta wolność projektowania i budowania sprawia, że każda planeta staje się twoim płótnem, a ty – artystą.
Jednym z kluczowych aspektów rozgrywki jest system zarządzania tlenem. Wymusza on strategiczne planowanie, zarówno podczas eksploracji, jak i budowy baz. Musisz dbać o dostępność tlenowych węży, które łączą cię z bazą, dodając napięcia każdej wyprawie w nieznane.
[h3] Dodatek Glitchwalkers – nowe przygody i wyzwania[/h3]
Niedawno wprowadzony dodatek Glitchwalkers wprowadza ogromne zmiany i rozszerza świat gry o nowe możliwości. Największą atrakcją jest nowa planeta – Aeoluz. Jest to najbardziej złożony świat w grze, pełen tajemnic, różnorodnych biomów i wyzwań, które zmuszają do kreatywnego podejścia. Nie tylko trzeba zmierzyć się z nowymi warunkami środowiskowymi, ale również z wrogim astronautą, który jest czymś zupełnie nowym w tej produkcji. To nie tylko wprowadza element rywalizacji, ale również dodaje warstwę emocji i konieczność opracowania nowych strategii.
[h3] Tryb multiplayer – przygoda w gronie przyjaciół[/h3]
Jednym z największych atutów Astroneer jest możliwość gry w trybie multiplayer dla maksymalnie czterech osób. Gra w kooperacji dodaje zupełnie nowy wymiar zabawy. Praca zespołowa, dzielenie obowiązków i wspólne eksplorowanie planet to doświadczenie, które trudno porównać z czymkolwiek innym. Budowanie bazy w grupie jest znacznie szybsze, ale to nie jedyna zaleta. Moment, w którym razem z przyjaciółmi przemierzacie nieznane zakątki planety, odkrywacie nowe zasoby i wspólnie radzicie sobie z wyzwaniami, to prawdziwa frajda.
Dodatkowo, tryb współpracy umożliwia podział ról – jedna osoba może zarządzać logistyką w bazie, druga eksplorować, a trzecia zbierać surowce. Dzięki temu każdy gracz może wnieść coś wyjątkowego do wspólnego projektu, a cała gra staje się jeszcze bardziej dynamiczna i angażująca. Wspólna praca nad pokonywaniem przeszkód to esencja zabawy w Astroneer.
[h3] Oprawa audiowizualna – kosmiczny minimalizm[/h3]
Astroneer wyróżnia się również swoją unikalną oprawą audiowizualną. Stylizowana, kolorowa grafika w połączeniu z relaksującą ścieżką dźwiękową tworzą atmosferę sprzyjającą długim sesjom gry. Każda planeta zachwyca designem, a efekty pogodowe, takie jak burze piaskowe, dodają dynamizmu i sprawiają, że świat gry wydaje się żywy.
[h3] Idealna harmonia eksploracji, kreatywności i współpracy[/h3]
Astroneer to gra, która zachwyca swoją prostotą, ale jednocześnie oferuje ogromną głębię rozgrywki. Niezależnie od tego, czy grasz solo, czy w trybie multiplayer, zawsze znajdziesz coś, co cię zainspiruje i wciągnie na długie godziny. Dodatek Glitchwalkers wprowadza nowe wyzwania i świeże elementy, które sprawiają, że gra jest jeszcze bardziej ekscytująca.

Dla mnie, Astroneer to nie tylko gra – to kosmiczna przygoda, którą można przeżywać na wiele sposobów. Jeśli szukasz produkcji, która pozwoli ci zarówno odpocząć, jak i rozwinąć kreatywność, a jednocześnie spędzić czas z przyjaciółmi, Astroneer jest wyborem idealnym.

Ocena końcowa: 9/10 – Gra, która zachwyca kreatywnością i współpracą, a z nowym dodatkiem wciąż zaskakuje!

185403156.review:
好玩好玩，我对这个游戏记忆非常深刻，上大学的时候用的破笔记本，看见同学steam就在玩这个，厚脸皮直接点了观看游戏，一进去就看见他在铺地，给我震撼住了心想居然自由度这么高。时隔四年一直躺在我愿望单，这次终于买来通关了！然后一开始我也拉了我那同学过来玩了一会，他就在那一顿造，我啥也不知道就挖材料。

说下这个游戏，比较难受的是它的教程引导，让人一头雾水，不知道要干什么，任务是知道要接的，但是不知道怎么造工具。铺地也不晓得，我只能充当挖材料的黑奴，不过最近官方更新了引导！

总体就是和面，玩过《戴森球》这我熟悉啊，缺完这就缺那，不过一开始准备好所有资源就十分方便了。其实也不用造自动化也能通关，它跟《戴森球》不一样，没那么肝。

bug很多，物体都是轻飘飘，有时候不小心乱丢东西就可能飞不知道哪里去了。物体没放好也会导致它一直在跳，走的时候莫名其妙听见地底下传来“kekeke”的声音以为闹鬼了。还有开大车的时候老是还能被一些物体卡住，还得人工去挖。

色彩十分喜欢，动画也超级可爱，我一直不知道这游戏还能养蜗牛的，发现之后很惊喜，蜗牛太可爱了，喂饱了还会打嗝。

每个星球都有各自特点，做主线挖洞的时候，还发现中间层会出现不同的景观。

对强迫症不友好，铺地很难受，因为球是圆的！铺地是平的，怎么铺都有点难受。然后那些产线的电线也十分容易扯断，摆着摆着就乱糟糟了。

联机还算顺畅，没开任何加速器，偶尔会出现一些上蹿下跳的bug，跟朋友一起联机玩的话会更好玩！！

185384926.review:
I really, really, want to like this game, but the issues with it are just too massive to make it fun. You can see by my number of hours I played the game a long time, but this was me attempting to play the game, many different times, across a lot of years, but every damn time I give up playing because of how broken the game is.

Point form issues:

-World loads like shit for non-host players. If non-host players move too fast they will fall out of the world, don't see dug holes until already standing in the air over them, or world loads up showing one thing, then suddenly changes it in the blink of an eye while close.

-Server randomly disconnects non-host players. Every time you get disconnected, your character instantly dies. You lose everything you had on you and need to find and loot your corpse. This is especially terrible if you were using a VTOL as good luck getting that back, or if you were deep in a mine.
-Winch in the game is horrifically buggy. Items you attach to a winch swing around like a stuck model in Half-Life 2/GMod and freak the heck out. This causes the game to lag massively and half of the time cause non-host players to get kicked out of the game.

-Missions are tedious: Even after getting to the tech level of having RTGs (unlimited power sources), and a VTOL, powering on the 'dim nodes' is massively tedious, and these tedious tasks stack up and up. Compounded with above issues it's absolutely aggravating.

-Death by falling 2 feet: Non-Host players repeatedly die by 'falling' out of vehicles just a couple of feet. I lost count how many times in the starter rover I died because when my character got out of the vehicle he appeared standing on the wheel, would slide and fall 2 feet, and instantly die on the spot. Driving any vehicle as a non-host is like this.

-The game has been out for YEARS has still doesn't have a basic Mouse Trap functionality to keep your game cursor in the game. If you have a multi-monitor setup, trying to turn your camera around will keep resulting in your mouse pointer flying out of the screen and randomly clicking on apps in other monitors. I lost count how many times I'd be clicking random crap on Discord because my pointer flew off the screen from me trying to 180 my character camera.

-Horrible camera/Vehicle drill: The camera seems to be infatuated with my character's ass. No matter how hard I try, if I'm in a train, exit a vehicle like a VTOL, drive a rover, etc. the camera constantly slowly pulls itself in towards my character and lowers itself to ass height. Getting out of the VTOL results in crotch-cam every single time I get out and I have to fight the camera to see something other than my crotch. While driving a rover and using the drill and paver you dig down or up based on the tilt of the camera (look up to dig up, look down to dig down), but how matter what you do, you are fighting the camera to keep your camera tilted up or down. There is a non-stop 'gravity' pull to pull your camera back to level. So you need to repeatedly right click, drag, let go, recenter your mouse, right click, drag, etc. repeatedly nonstop while digging a tunnel. You need to keep fighting the camera every couple of seconds or else your tunnel will end up levelling off on you suddenly.

---

I love the artistic direction of this game, I love the crafting and modular design, and I love how someone finally made a low impact fun game you can casually play with friends, but the issues just keep compounding and I eventually give up. If these glitches weren't so frustrating I'd have accepted the tedious nature of some of the missions, but when compounded with the above issues it just makes the experience far too unplesant.

I've been really enjoying Astroneer, despite some bugs (items sinking into the ground or flying into the air and getting stuck) and crashes (no autosave, meaning I've lost huge chunks of progress whenever the game suddenly just stops working).
However, I just got to a point in a quest where I placed a portal down, and when I tried to enter it, I was redirected to a DLC page. I looked around online, and it seems like no one is able to remove the portal without buying the $9.99 DLC.
I don't want to keep playing with this glowing advertisement in my face, especially since there was no warning that starting the quest would lead to a paywall, and no warning that the portal would be permanent unless you pay for the DLC.
It's left a sour taste in my mouth about the whole glitchy game, so I'm done with Astroneer. Maybe I'll start a new game someday if they listen to their players and fix this.

185148493.review:
There's a lot I like about this game. The terrain deformation system is super interesting and mining resources feels great. I also think the diegetic nature of items and inventories is awesome and super unique. I think it's cool how there's basically no "screens" except for what you can find in the pause menu - everything else is actually a part of the world and can be interacted with pretty seamlessly. The way the different "tiers" of items are handled in this system is also really clever.

My main issue with the game is the amount of waiting it expects you to do. Some of the machines I've worked with in this game are really slow, even at full power, not to mention their speed when they're NOT at full power. I know you're probably expected to set up automation and do something else while stuff is processing but I disagree with that design choice tbh. The power issue also makes it so certain machines are significantly less portable, since you also have to transport a way to reliably power them if you don't wanna wait for ages for them to process.

I've also had some issues with the controls, although I'm unsure if this is an actual design problem or a skill issue tbh. With how many functions are bound to left-click, I sometimes end up doing one thing when I'm trying to do another, like opening my backpack or pinging a spot on the ground when I'm trying to pick something up. Pinging is obviously harmless but opening my backpack on accident has been pretty annoying. I just use the hotkey for the backpack anyway, so I think an option to click through the player instead of opening the backpack would be nice.

185136075.review:
Astroneer: A Colorful and Creative Adventure into the Cosmos

Astroneer is one of those rare games that combines the thrill of exploration with the joy of creativity in a way that feels uniquely refreshing. From the moment I set foot on an alien planet, I was captivated by its colorful, stylized world and the endless possibilities that awaited me. As a fan of sandbox games, Astroneer has been an absolute delight, offering a relaxing yet engaging experience that has kept me coming back for more.

At its core, Astroneer is all about exploration and resource gathering in an open, procedurally generated universe. You play as an astronaut, stranded on one of many planets, and your goal is to survive, explore, and build while uncovering the mysteries of each world. The game’s visual style is immediately striking—bright, pastel colors and charming, geometric shapes create a world that feels both whimsical and awe-inspiring. Every planet is a new canvas, full of resources to collect, terrain to shape, and alien landscapes to discover.

The mechanics of Astroneer are both simple and incredibly satisfying. You begin with basic tools that allow you to dig, gather, and reshape the terrain. The beauty of the game lies in how these simple mechanics come together to form a deeper, more complex experience. Digging and sculpting the environment is incredibly satisfying, and the way you can build and shape structures is a joy in itself. The game encourages creativity, and there’s a real sense of freedom as you design your base, craft new vehicles, and terraform the environment. The ease with which you can manipulate the terrain and construct elaborate structures makes you feel like a true pioneer on an unknown planet, building something out of nothing.

The sense of progression in Astroneer is fantastic. As you gather resources and research new technologies, you unlock more advanced tools and equipment, allowing you to explore further and tackle tougher challenges. The game’s crafting system is intuitive, and the ability to automate processes with vehicles, drills, and other machinery makes even the most mundane tasks feel rewarding. The thrill of discovering new resources, building new modules, and unlocking new planets to explore never gets old.

What really sets Astroneer apart, however, is its emphasis on exploration and discovery. There’s a real sense of wonder as you land on a new planet and start to explore its unique environment. Whether it’s the icy, desolate landscape of one planet or the lush, vibrant flora of another, each new world feels distinct and exciting. The multiplayer mode adds even more depth, allowing you to team up with friends to explore together, build shared bases, and work as a team to solve challenges.

Astroneer also has a very relaxed pace, which makes it a perfect game to unwind with. There’s no pressure to “win” or rush through objectives; instead, the focus is on enjoying the process of exploration, building, and creating. The game’s sense of freedom and its non-competitive nature make it a great escape from the more intense and fast-paced games in my library. Whether I’m spending hours crafting the perfect base or simply wandering a new planet, Astroneer offers an incredibly calming experience that never feels tedious.

In conclusion, Astroneer is a true gem in the world of sandbox games. Its blend of creativity, exploration, and discovery makes it a relaxing yet deeply satisfying adventure. The freedom to explore new planets, gather resources, and build your own futuristic world makes it an experience that is endlessly enjoyable. If you’re looking for a game that encourages imagination and exploration, Astroneer is a must-play. It’s a cosmic journey I’m excited to continue, and one that I wholeheartedly recommend to any player who loves creativity and adventure.

185098927.review:
The good:
It's a very chill multiplayer game without fighting that lets you mine, build bases and production lines and partially automate things. It also has quite a bit of exploration: a couple of planets that not only have a surface, but also differ in the underground, which has multiple layers. You can walk completely around a planet and the physics make sense - the planet is actually curved and building a straight ramp downwards into the ground will have you come out somewhere else on the surface walking upwards. 
Also, cute gastropods.

The bad:
The quests are often quite tedious and after unlocking all materials, they feel even worse. There is no intrinsic goals I can see to keep playing. Other games allow more automation or beautifying bases, sometimes with NPCs. This is somewhat lacking here. There is no good way to align machines and the terraforming tools are not really made to make anything but flat ground or flat walls. As far as I can see you can't even color them outside of creative mode. Another problem is that what is needed to build a base (soil) is freely available from the start of the game, so there is no feeling of progression if that is your goal. 
The start of the game is also a bit rough because not all controls are immediately obvious. It took me a while to use the terrain tool correctly. Knowing what's possible with terrain tool and leveling block isn't really taught well by the game. 

You can get 50-100 hours out of this game easily and most of it is quite good. After unlocking every material and a gateway engine or two, it starts to get boring very quickly.

185035701.review:
🔢 Puntuación: 7/10

📝 Resumen: recoge recursos, construye cosas para conseguir mas recursos y luego repite eso en otro planeta para conseguir aun mas recursos.

🕹️ Jugabilidad (7/10): la verdad que a veces es un poco coñazo el coger y dejar recursos en su sitio. Pulsar F cuando coges algo para que se te ponga automatico en la mochila es tu mejor aliado, pero es que te veras unas 500 veces sin querer desmontando tu base solo por que has levantado tu impresora de cosas en vez de abrir su menu.

Eso si...puedes contruir una linea de trenes...I mean...

📈 Gráficos y Diseño (7/10): no son malos, osea, se puede jugar sin que te sangren los ojos aun que tampoco sean lo mejor del mundo

🎶 Sonido y Música (meh): meh, aunque me gusta mucho el sonido de "blop, bling bling bling" que hacen las cosas cuando las construyas.

🧠 Historia y Narrativa: No tiene de eso

🎯 Contenido y Rejugabilidad: contenido un poco pobre, minar recursos es una de las cosas mas importantes de Astroneer, pero es muy basico. Creo que deberia haber sido más divertido, por que puedes hacer vehiculos escavadores y trenes pero es que la mineria es tan basica que no tiene mucho sentido. Con esto quiero decir, tardas mas en elaborar una linea de tren que en coger las 3 cosas que necesitas de la cueva subterranea.

He jugado 24h y no he terminado el juego, pero es que tampoco tengo gran incentivo para hacerlo y no lo jugaria otra vez.

💡 Lo mejor del juego: Sin duda que es cooperativo. Jugue con mi novia y una amiga y la verdad que al principio te sientes algo perdido mientras tratas de averiguar de que demonios va la cosa. Tampoco hay tutoriales ni na asi que te la tienes que apañar un poco. Lo mejor es ir consiguiendo recursos, construir tu base, para luego descubrir más cosas que construir y mas cosas con las que mejorar tu base para luego expandirte a otro planeta por que en este hay un recurso que no hay en el tuyo. 

❌ Lo peor del juego: muy basico en algunas cosas, no tiene enemigos, ni nada que lo haga sentir remotamente peligroso. Tambien hay aspectos como conseguir recursos que me parecen muy basicos y hacer una base nueva en otro planeta esta guay por primera vez, pero la segunda ya no.


🔚 Conclusión: si te lo puedes pillar a 10 euros y tienes amigos con quienes jugar, te lo vas a pasar bastante bien si el juego te atrae lo mas minimo. Te engancharás super fuerte las primeras 20 horas y luego gradualmente irá revocando tus ganas de explotar planetas por recursos.

184858820.review:
Ach Astroneer!

So ein knuffiges Spiel mit einer so angenehmen Spielgeschwindigkeit, aber gleichzeitig so einem tiefen Spielerlebnis. Egal, ob Allein oder im Koop! Ich habe da viele schöne Stunden verbracht. 

Wobei es auch einige Bugs immer noch gibt. Gegenstände/Materialien verschwinden im Boden. Manchmal kann man an Minikanten sterben, ohne tief zu fallen und ein paar Mal verschwand meine super ausgebautes Gefährt in den unendlichen des Weltalls, weil die Physik es "so wollte". Das hat dann zum Teil einen großen Frustfaktor.

Aber für all das wird man vielfach entschädigt. Meine letzte Basis war so super effizient gewesen, mit lauter Automatisierungsketten, dass es eine Freude war, einfach nur zu zuschauen. 

Wieviel mehr Kreativität von anderen SpielerInnen durch dieses Spiel zu Tage tritt, kann man sich in unzähligen Videos im Internet anschauen.

184774079.review:
Astroneer - 5/5
To jedna z najlepszych gier o eksploracji kosmosu. Jest tak wiele rzeczy do wydrukowania i mnóstwo rzeczy, które zapewnią ci rozrywkę. Główna historia jest tak tajemnicza, że ​​jej ukończenie zajmuje dużo czasu i ogólnie jest niesamowita. Zdecydowanie poleciłbym każdemu, aby spróbował samodzielnie zrozumieć główny wątek, bez szukania kolejnych etapów. Korzystanie z pojazdów jest przyjemne i istnieje wiele strategii, które można z nimi zastosować. Jedynymi wrogami w grze są rośliny i choć wydaje się, że łatwo jest tego uniknąć, tak nie jest i stanowi to kolejne wyzwanie w grze. Glacio jest zdecydowanie najlepszą planetą w grze, jeśli chodzi o materiały. Wszystkie planety mają inną grawitację, cykle dnia i nocy, materiały i stopień trudności. Ta gra jest po prostu niesamowita, a twórcy wciąż dodają do niej znacznie więcej zawartości. Ogólnie rzecz biorąc, jest to po prostu niesamowita gra, którą zdecydowanie polecam Ci wypróbować.

The worlds are boring, the missions and UI seem to have been designed by someone who has never used a computer before. I would not recommend this game to anyone for co-op, especially when the non-host player gets consistently stuck in death loops on respawn, engine sounds play endlessly and are visually bugged and items lag and teleport all over the place. Just an awful and frustrating experience we both wish we would have avoided after completing the "main story". Big thumbs down.

184634027.review:
[i]Отличная игра, которая предлагает огромное разнообразие занятий в открытом мире, позволяя исследовать, строить и просто наслаждаться процессом. На протяжении полутора лет я изредка играл на консоли, так как своей не было. Теперь, купив игру на новогодней распродаже в Steam, я наконец-то смог углубиться в неё и достичь многих высот всего за несколько дней. Однако всегда остаётся, к чему стремиться, что делает игру ещё более увлекательной.[/i]

[h3]Плюсы (+++):[/h3]
[list]
    [*]Разнообразие планет: Игра предлагает множество уникальных планет с различными ресурсами, что мотивирует к исследованию.
    [*]Баланс в добыче ресурсов: Иногда нужный материал сложно добыть быстро, но это не ощущается как искусственное затягивание геймплея. Это здорово!
    [*]Дружественность к пользователям: Сохранения поддерживаются даже при переходе с пиратской версии на лицензионную.
[/list]

[h3]Минусы (---):[/h3]
[list]
    [*]Отсутствие кроссплатформенных сохранений: Было бы здорово, если бы сейвы синхронизировались между разными платформами. Инструкций по ручной настройке этого тоже не хватает.
    [*]Низкий уровень опасности: В игре мало моментов, где персонажу реально угрожает смерть. Это может быть минусом для тех, кто хочет ощутить больше эмоций от риска. (За всё время я умирал только от падений.) Возможно, эту проблему можно решить с помощью модов.
[/list]
 
[h3]Итог:[/h3]
[b]"Astroneer" — это игра, которая идеально подойдёт для любителей неспешного исследования и творчества. Хотелось бы больше опасностей и кроссплатформенных функций, но в целом это качественный проект. Моя оценка: 8/10.[/b]

184523489.review:
Mission Log: George Droyd

Date: Sol 27 (27th Martian day of mission)
Location: Mars, Sector A37, Near Olympus Mons
Mission Objective: Search for air or sources of breathable oxygen.

07:45: Systems check complete. Oxygen levels in personal life-support system are stable. Rover "Aurora" is functioning within operational parameters. Today's objective is to analyze the atmosphere and soil for traces of oxygen-rich compounds.

08:10: Departed Base Camp Delta. Navigation is set for a suspected mineral deposit flagged during orbital scans. The deposit lies approximately 3 kilometers southeast.

08:45: Arrived at the mineral site. External sensors detect faint traces of oxygen within surface cracks. Deployed "TerraProbe" to begin soil sampling and analysis. Early results indicate the presence of perchlorates, but their oxygen-releasing potential is unclear without further processing.

09:30: Initiated atmospheric sampling via "OxiScanner-2." Martian atmosphere is as expected: 95.3% carbon dioxide, 2.7% nitrogen, 1.6% argon, and a minuscule 0.13% oxygen. No anomalies detected. Beginning extended scan for trace compounds that could be catalyzed to release oxygen.

10:50: Received anomalous readings from the southern ridge. There’s a slight increase in oxygen concentration (0.18%) in localized pockets. Possible connection to subsurface geological activity? Adjusting route to investigate.

11:40: Reached southern ridge. Geological formations appear to be volcanic in origin. Observed faint steam-like emissions from a fissure. The emissions dissipate quickly but carry a slightly elevated oxygen concentration. Sampled gas and marked the location for future study.

13:00: Returning to Base Camp Delta for detailed analysis. Preliminary hypothesis: oxygen may be trapped in subsurface reservoirs or chemically bound in minerals, being released by geothermal activity. This could be a significant lead for generating breathable air in situ.

15:30: Back at Base Camp Delta. Samples transferred to lab module for processing. Preliminary data confirms the presence of bound oxygen in perchlorates and a minor release of molecular oxygen from fissure gas. This supports the potential for oxygen extraction using existing mission tech.

16:45: Filed findings with mission control. Recommended follow-up exploration of geothermal sites and testing of oxygen-extraction methods in field conditions.

18:00: Mission log update complete. Personal note: The faint traces of oxygen, though minimal, inspire hope. Mars still holds its secrets, but today, it whispered one.

End of Log

184505763.review:
Good fun with the family, except when the kids decide to wander off and die in a crevice. 

"Daddy, i died"

A phrase i've heard countless times now.  I give up trying to find the body and salvage what I can.  All the tool boosters and whatnot.  Just give your kid a battery and a couple oxygen tanks and send them on missions to gather resources.

As for myself, I find the game amusing and calming. It's not super stressful and once you get the hang of it, it can be quite calming.

Just be mindful of your real life and real life responsibilities as this game can suck up your time.  The game is quite affordable so don't be shy if you like space themed survival games.

If you are looking at this game after playing Space Engineer, then this woud be a much simpler version of that. If you're done with Astroneer, then have a look at Space Engineer. Both are related but I like the calming simplicity of Astroneer when comparing the two.

184486008.review:
I used to dislike this game, but as I played it more and more my opinion on the game began to change. Astroneer is all about building up your technology and unlocking more and more things. The core gameplay loop is finding resources, unlocking things, and building them with those resources. While that may sound boring, Astroneer somehow makes keeps it interesting. I have no idea how they do it, but the game rarely gets boring. Theres always something to do, and always something to work towards. The artstyle is also another part of the game that I really enjoyed. Theres something quite charming about the low-poly style that really fits it well. The game really has a certain charm to it that really makes it distinct. 

7.5/10

184422962.review:
This game started as an incredibly fun experience. The mechanics, exploration, and potential for creativity kept me engaged for hours. However, my enthusiasm quickly waned due to persistent and game-breaking bugs—specifically involving cars.

The main issue is that cars often sink into the ground, effectively vanishing and causing me to lose progress. Additionally, when I dig paths for the vehicles, they barely move and often just spin in place, making traversal and resource transportation a frustrating ordeal. These bugs aren’t just minor annoyances; they undermine the core gameplay experience and leave me feeling like my efforts are wasted.

What’s even more disappointing is the developers’ approach. Instead of addressing these glaring issues, they seem more focused on rolling out DLCs. While additional content might be exciting, it’s hard to justify buying DLC when the base game feels broken in key areas. In fact, the lack of attention to these bugs has not only discouraged me from buying the DLC but also made me stop playing the game entirely.

This game has so much potential, but until the developers prioritize fixing these critical issues, I can’t recommend it.

184400074.review:
When you strafe from side to side, the camera rotates. This gives me severe motion sickness in a way that no other game has before, and there's no way to entirely turn this off. You can avoid this by holding down the right mouse button, but that would get tiring (mentally and physically) very quickly. There's a setting to allow right clicking to TOGGLE to that mode, which is better, but then when right clicking to change the camera view, it turns back to the other mode.

I can't play this game as-is, and I'm surprised that there hasn't been a mod to address this glaring issue.

184055682.review:
Está bien, muy chulo.

Es muy bonito y es satisfactoria la manera en que las "cosas" conectan entre sí.
Es como que todo son módulos que se pueden acoplar a otras cosas. Muy entretenido.

Como puntos negativos diría que es muy molesto intentar aplanar el terreno para hacer la base (y no me refiero a 'true flat', me refiero a hacerlo plano pero siguiendo la curva del planeta en cuestión.
Ojalá hubiera una manera de decirle a la herramienta de terreno que quieres a aplanar a X altura y que vaya siguiendo la curva del planeta.

La conducción de vehículos debería tener como opción la primera persona y/o cambiar los controles para controlar la altura a la que aplanas el terreno.

No me gusta tampoco que ciertas ubicaciones de la historia que puedes spawnear tú mismo no puedas moverlas de sitio después.
Si no sabes lo que estás haciendo, cómo ha sido mi caso, te puedes encontrar después con que tienes ese trozo de la base súper mal colocado y ya no hay nada que puedas hacer al respecto.

184023775.review:
Lovely game, if you don't mind the endless grind for the equipment you need, to go fetch the exact same equipment you just lost due to some bug. Wanna jump out of your shuttle that is standing perfectly fine on a landing pad? No, you take fall damage and die. Wanna fetch those things you then just lost? Sure, just jump out of the same shuttle and die again. Third times the charm though, but now the stuff in you backpack is spread out like some sort of poor victim that stepped on a landmine. 

At the time of writing this I've logged 108 hours - where 65 hours is getting stuff I once already had. 
This review is also written in blind rage - as I am stuck on the god forsaken planet of Atrox. 

I thought trying to 100% the game would be an enjoyable time- but the bugs makes this game so erroneously redundant.

184012763.review:
Astroneer Video Game Review Recipe

Ingredients:
1 part stunning planetary exploration
2 cups of innovative terrain manipulation
A generous serving of cooperative multiplayer fun
A dash of creative base building
A sprinkle of resource gathering and crafting
A hint of whimsical art style

Directions:
Preheat your curiosity by embarking on an interstellar journey. The stunning planetary exploration in Astroneer offers a visually captivating and serene experience that encourages endless discovery.

Combine the innovative terrain manipulation with your adventurous spirit. Using the Terrain Tool, you can shape the land, dig tunnels, and build structures, allowing for a deeply interactive environment.

Mix in the cooperative multiplayer fun. Invite friends to join your expedition, working together to explore, gather resources, and build bases. The collaborative gameplay ensures a delightful and shared adventure.

Fold in the creative base building. Construct bases on various planets, each with unique challenges and resources. The freedom to design and expand your bases adds a layer of personal creativity to the game.

Sprinkle with resource gathering and crafting. Collect diverse materials from alien landscapes and use them to craft tools, vehicles, and modules, enhancing your exploration capabilities.

Add a hint of whimsical art style. The vibrant and stylized visuals create a charming and inviting atmosphere that makes every moment in the game a visual treat.

Tasting Notes:
Best enjoyed by fans of exploration, creativity, and cooperative gameplay. Pairs well with a relaxed evening, a group of friends, and a sense of wonder. The freedom to explore and manipulate the terrain offers a uniquely engaging experience.
The cooperative multiplayer mode enhances the enjoyment and encourages teamwork and creativity.

Bon appétit! And let the stars guide you!

183836603.review:
Clumsy controls, incredibly clumsy camera, no labels on anything (just toddler-style iPad icons), and the tutorial/encyclopedia just lists the keyboard shortcuts with still images.  And Q is how you access your inventory.  Really?  Was this thing made by Martians?  Q???  If you're going to make non-intuitive game systems, put some work into the tutorial so that there is a bare minimum of guidance. 

2nd mission in the game (The first is to click a button in order to get the items for the 2nd mission.  Which button?  Press stuff until you figure it out because it'll put hair on your chest or something.) :
Oxygenator unpacked and installed?  OK, no problem.  Connect the printer (which was larger than the uninstalled oxygenator, a car-sized habitat module once installed) to the habitat's power supply?  Fair enough, but how?  After messing around for 10 minutes trying to install the thing to the habitat or activate the plug-looking items on the sides of the habitat, I managed to plug this cow-sized module into my backpack somehow (it shrank by a factor of 20, magically) and the quest completed.  I don't even know if that's what I was supposed to do, but I didn't care at that point, because it was so stupid that I uninstalled the game.  If they can't be bothered to make the second quest in the game's text sensible, I'm not even remotely interested.  How about "Install the printer in your backpack" ????  Or put a little glowing square around the spot in your backpack where it's supposed to go?  

There are so many of these games that it doesn't make sense to spend your time with one that is this clunky.

183537366.review:
- Quero deixar claro que tenho este jogo dês de 2020 e ele me frustrou muito, o tanto de bugs que ocorreram e ainda ocorrem ate hoje são gritantes, é uma vergonha uma empresa lançar um jogo e depois de anos não fazer o minimo.

- Vamos começar por partes, em primeiro lugar eu achei este jogo extremamente repetitivo e enjoativo, você faz literalmente a mesma coisa em 7 planetas diferentes, enfrentado umas plantas broxas e fazendo missões chatas. Para mim existem jogos com a mesma proposta que são muito mais interessantes, com muitos mais planetas, desafios e missões realmente interessantes (vulgo jogo lançado em 2016).

- Em relação aos bugs, no começo eles foram engraçados, os únicos momentos onde eu realmente me diverti e ri foram quando o jogo bugava, era tão escroto que chegava a ser engraçado e por eu estar jogando com amigos isso foi ainda mais intensificado. Porém depois de um tempo, obviamente estes bugs começaram a incomodar muito, havia momentos que eu não aguentava mais jogar e ficava ainda mais frustrado, eles não ocorriam tanto no começo do jogo, mas depois que eu avançava um pouco e já havia ativado alguns planetas, eles triplicavam.

- Em resumo os bugs ocorriam mais quando eu jogava crossplay (eu no pc e meu amigo no ps4), mas depois que ambos começaram a jogar no pc, deu uma leve melhorada. Os bugs que eu posso relatar são: veículos e recursos atravessando o chão e entrando dentro da terra, personagem saindo voando para fora do planeta, cabos se estendendo infinitamente, mortes aleatórias e sem sentido (do nada eu morria quando estava em um portal ou a gravidade do jogo bugava e eu morria de queda de uma altura pequena).

*obs: eu só joguei 143h porque este jogo é tão ruim que estou dês de 2020 tentando zerar e só este ano (2024) eu consegui, eu também platinei essa bomba para nunca mais precisar abrir essa merda.

*resumo: jogo chato, repetitivo, desinteressante, com missões chatas, sem desafios e com um péssimo fator replay. Os únicos inimigos são plantas, não tem animais, não tem clima, não tem água e você faz a mesma coisa o jogo inteiro, além da lore ser inexistente. Este jogo é para pessoas que tem muito tempo livre, paciência e adoram jogos casuais de construção de base.

183536944.review:
As a space nerd, I LOVE this game! The developers seem really passionate about this game with the continuous updates released. I keep taking long breaks from the game and I come back to see that so much stuff is added. Last time I played there was large rovers now there's freaking VTOLS and trains! IN SPACE!!

The art style is very cute, and the planets' wild life is creative, and the game itself is not too complicated as there's an in game encyclopedia (Astropedia). You can just goof around in a sandbox, complete missions, or try to unlock endings.

 Also, collecting resources gives massive dopamine.
